flashcards.english: My son has his spear in his stomach (Riddle: Bee)
flashcards.notes: Traditional Kikuyu riddle from 1935 Catholic Mission Press reader. Answer: Njûki (bee) - reference to bee's stinger

source.origin: Easy Kikuyu Lesson 080 - Std. IV Reader 1935

flashcards.kikuyu: Mbûrî ciathîî mbere ciatiga gîtune thutha
flashcards.english: The goats have gone ahead leaving redness behind (Riddle: Dust)
flashcards.notes: Traditional riddle. Answer: Rukungu (dust) - red dust kicked up by goats walking

source.origin: Easy Kikuyu Lesson 080 - Std. IV Reader 1935

flashcards.english: Your farm has been ploughed without your consent (Riddle: Flash flood)
flashcards.notes: Traditional riddle. Answer: Kigûû (flash flood) - sudden flood carves channels like ploughing

source.origin: Easy Kikuyu Lesson 082 - Std. IV Reader 1935

flashcards.english: You have walked with a person who does not ask to rest (Riddle: Shadow)
flashcards.notes: Traditional riddle. Answer: Kîrûru (shadow) - your shadow follows without tiring

source.origin: Easy Kikuyu Lesson 082 - Std. IV Reader 1935

flashcards.kikuyu: Twakûhoya ûtûhonokie harî nyamû cîîtagwo andû
flashcards.english: We pray to you to save us from animals called humans
flashcards.notes: Wild animals' prayer to Mwathanî (Lord) - poignant commentary on conservation. Context: Huria nîciathira (Rhinos are finished), Ithuî njogu tûkûûrîra kû? (We elephants, where shall we run to?)
